results.title: Raft
results.brief_description: An account of an annual 1000km voyage by a family of four on a balsa raft down the Parnaiba River in Brazil. Their destination is a small town in Teresina, where their pottery, livestock and the raft will be sold. After the slow month long journey, the family is faced with the problem of the return trip. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Radioisotopes in industry
results.creator_credit: U K Atomic Energy Authority, Film Producers Guild, G. Buckland-Smith and W. B. Pollard
results.brief_description: Britain is the world’s largest exporter of radioactive isotopes. This film shows something of the theory and practice of manufacturing radioisotopes and some of their many industrial applications.

results.title: Radioisotope analytical techniques in mineral processing
results.creator_credit: Perier Films and Australian Atomic Energy Commission
results.brief_description: Shows use of radioisotopes in continuous on-stream analysis in mineral processing. Describes how the technique was developed by the Commission and its value in immediate and accurate detection of valuable elements. Suggests possible application in automatic control.

results.title: Radio view of the universe
results.creator_credit: Modern Learning Aids, Alfred Butterfield and Bert Shapiro
results.brief_description: In this film, Dr M.S. Roberts of the National Radio Astronomy Observatory in Green Bank, West Virginia, explains the use of the radio line of atomic hydrogen in determining the total hydrogen content of galaxies external to the Milky Way. He then establishes the strong correlation between hydrogen content and galactic shape and raises the question as to whether this correlation can be used as an indicator of galactic evolution.

results.title: Radio Tirana: harmony and forschung
results.creator_credit: Trizeps Video, Helmut Stadlmann and Michael Langoth
results.brief_description: A collaboration between avant-garde video makers and musicians which utilises computer animation, video collage, and media cut-ups to present some cutting edge music compositions. An Austrian production, this video is an excellent introduction to the experimental sounds of European electronic and industrial music.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Trizeps Video, Helmut Stadlmann and Michael Langoth

results.title: Radio sky
results.creator_credit: Viewpoint Productions, Michael Clarke and Michael Crossfield
results.brief_description: Radio astronomy reveals a picture of the universe beyond optical limits. How radio telescopes work is illustrated by views of various types in operation, and plotting and interpretation of radio sources is discussed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Viewpoint Productions, Michael Clarke and Michael Crossfield

results.title: Radio service
results.creator_credit: Cecil Musk Productions, Film Producers Guild and Cecil Musk
results.brief_description: You may expect this film, because of its title, to show you what happens when you send your radio set to a mechanic for repairs. In fact, the film deals with the enormous development of electronics during the past 50 years (prior to 1948) of modern history. Commentator: Deryck Guyler.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cecil Musk Productions, Film Producers Guild and Cecil Musk

results.title: Radio Dog
results.brief_description: In Albion, an anarchist republic of the near future, Felix is listening to Radio Dog as he shaves off his beard. His daydreams gradually form a kaleidoscope portrait of the mongrel city, where doctors serve liquid sunshine on the concrete beach and savage diesel rhythms shake the massive Gun Fetish Club.

results.title: Radio days
results.creator_credit: Orion Pictures Corporation, Robert Greenhut and Woody Allen
results.brief_description: I love old radio stories, and I know a million of them. I’ve collected them down through the years like a hobby. Anecdotes, gossip and inside stories about the stars. Plus I recall so many personal experiences, from when I grew up, listening to show after show. Now it’s all gone, except for the memories. Let Woody Allen take you back to the golden era of the radio days. Linking a number of colourful radio stories with a delightful look at his own childhood, the writer-director recreates a lost era. Discover the Masked Avengers horrible secret! See how a beautiful blonde cigarette girl goes on to find stardom! And how some burglars win the star prize on radio “Guess that tune” for their unsuspecting victims!! Allen’s ensemble of actors includes Mia Farrow, Diane Keaton, Julie Kavner and Dianne Wiest.

results.title: Radio day
results.brief_description: A promotional exercise that shows a day in the life of radio station 3XY in Melbourne. Although most of the activities carried out in a commercial radio station are depicted, there is no attempt to explain why and as such this production does little to demystify the process. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
